TopicTitle: No problems here, just some questions about cfg files

Articles.Content:
So I edited the MM cfg cache a bit to make Snacks! compatible with the base game's ore tanks, as well as the tanks in Restock+. What I did was use SimpleFuelSwitch (basically a dumbed-down InterstellarFuelSwitch) to modify the ore tanks in stock and restock+, so that instead of just holding ore, they can be configured to hold either ore, snacks, or soil. Pretty simple change overall, but I did have a difficult time rewriting in the MM cache tho, since my computer has very little RAM and it was very slow to delete or write anything.

However, I was wondering if it was possible to make a seperate cfg file outside of the MM cache, so that it doesn't possibly interfere with the rest of the mods that are in the cache. But I have no idea how that stuff works, so I come here with some questions on how to do this.

Where would I put the file? How would I make it find the MM cache and the ore tank parts in the cache? How would I remove the RESOURCE module in each tank, and replace it with the SimpleFuelSwitch modules? Would I have to copy-paste the whole section of code in each ore tank? Or can I just make it find the lines that I need removed, and replace those lines with the new lines.

Thanks for the help!

 

Edited November 23, 2020 by RedBee92
